9vgyDD43OdkD2AmQuxRaMQ.text: Simply put: Fantastic pizza, short wait time (for carry out), and very reasonably priced.

xC11UHeSKw_VHzzUF5LiJA.text: The pizza is incredible. All of the ingredients shine through. I even ordered one without cheese (lactose intolerant), and it blew me away. And at 7 pounds per pizza (you need at least half of one to fill you up, a whole one for me), its a great deal.

-Dc_gPF_uCWtKy9J9SF7rA.text: This South Ken branch opened in late 2014 and has been jam packed every time I've passed by.The menu is reassuringly short. 6 choices with quality ingredients and safe combinations. I had Pizza 4 - Gloucester Old Spot Ham (Home Cured), mozzarella, buffalo ricotta, and wild mushrooms. I am a sucker for ricotta and will try it wherever possible, and it did not disappoint. It was creamy and heart warming, as ricotta should be.Now, Franco Manca sells itself through its sourdough, but that unique taste didn't come out as strongly for me. Considering they spend a minimum 20 hours letting the dough rise, I was expecting it to be a kicker of a taste (it was good, the crust was soft, the base was thin). What blew me away though was the home cured meat. Glorious texture, glorious taste - would go back just for the meat.Glad to have so many branches around London to enjoy an inexpensive artisan pizza. But definitely do go at an odd hour or expect to wait in the new branches! I will try a tomato, mozzarella and basil next to get to the proper sourdough taste.USP: Excellent toppings.Go with: Somebody that you want to talk to as you wait in line.Price: Low: £4-7 per pizza.Comparison: A simpler, cheaper, more local Pizza Pilgrims! Major win on the meat.

TLbX_u9PKi3XQjaGSjgt4w.text: Crazy delicious pizza served in a very small restaurant with shared tables - don't go for the atmosphere but if you want efficient service and really tasty pizza- this is the place!

TfE4gjt_34M8OZ7_Tp-FHw.text: Great & unique pies -- flavorful toppings & crustQuick & efficient service as the space is crowdedGood selection of wines by the glass

K6wq95YLj8XZen5LYX2pxg.text: 10 min wait was worth it!  The pizza and service were phenomenal!!! It is 3 min walk from the Kensington Double Tree.  They were accommodating to children. It is all fresh. The crust, I dare say, is better than a NY or Chicago pizza!

xa4S3Um1H6-GAV2zN4AolA.text: outstanding pizza.  rustic, fresh, and tasty.  if you are with a group order different kinds and share.  service excellent.  nice place.

aEvzXWVNzAVwgH__AZXHyw.text: Absolutely delicious. Warm welcome. Fast service. Good prices. We queued outside for a while but it was well worth the wait.  The only problem is the noise.  The restaurant was full of very loud people perhaps because the music was quite loud and we also had to shout to talk.

M8gtHmm692j8vHyq1iXLGQ.text: always love a good franco manca pizza

m102GH4W8bCopTWhLqk0BA.text: Friendly staff & great pizza! Very busy place to eat-in, but take-away pizza was done in 15 minutes & I was on my way. Great & fresh ingredients, but the crust had a little bit of a funky taste

nAorRY_Xy8hP4tyFeL0_ug.text: I am so glad that I stumbled upon this place. Warm, friendly environment with kind and attentive staff. Oh yeah, the food is also great and priced for the budget conscious.

cWAZ029wRZOmrJY0kNNanQ.text: We had to wait 30 minutes to get a table so we put our name down and went around the block to covent market. (Strike 1) We Almost went to Union Jack but for some unknown reason we walked back to Franca. While we continued to wait outside for the table, a nice lady came outside and started handing out small slices of pizza. Possible because of the long wait or Bc she wanted us to get even more hungry while we waited. The four of us got seated downstairs  with another couple we did not know (strike 2) and while we hoped to eat upstairs, the taste of that small slice of pizza outside still lingered somewhere on our tongues.  We had a sampling of the red wine (both house and organic). Decided to go with Club of Queen's House wine bottle. Excellent choice. After 2 small bites, the mozzarella prosciutto and the bruschetta, our mouths started feeling really happy!!!  We could not wait for the pizzas we ordered! After getting 4 pizzas, we slowly and quietly ate the first bite. It was very difficult as the slices were not pre cut so it annoyed us a little and that almost got the 3rd strike. But after the first slice of part thereof, we went into a state of awesomeness. These pizzas were truly the best we have had in a long time. No more strikes, we hit a HOME RUN!! We only gave this place a 4 star because the prices were too cheap (50 pounds for 4 persons) and the noise too loud due to the people complaining they ate too much. We will surely come back when we visit to London again! This is my first review so enjoy it!!

Aw2x4shIBwbCQ-jsaakyUA.text: The only reason I'm giving this place one star is because the pizza was excellent. However the service isn't just bad. It's actually goes below and beyond bad. It's seems like the staff could careless whether you order or receive the proper order for that matter. I thought it was just our table but everyone around us was rumbling about the bad service.  To the owner:  if you're to continue dishing out excellent pizza just fire your entire staff including any relatives.  Start fresh.

d41YkTMOBNbVBoIFMzhyHQ.text: So I decided to try this place as there are rave reviews.  It was a long wait about 20 mins. To be honest, I feel it is more a 3.5 star place.  The ambiance is cozy and the staff friendly!  I tried pizza number 4 but to be honest I can't drum up to same enthusiasm as other reviewers.  The pizza dough was really delish, but I wasn't impressed with the ham (off day maybe)?. I'd give it another go if I were in the vicinity of a Franca Manca but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.

i0P5u-1fu67mRMce2yJcdg.text: The pizza was the best I have ever had! Not only was it made fresh inside the kitchen, and you could observe them make it, the dough was made of sourdough! They had many choices to choose from , and the staff were nice, and friendly. It is a very fair price for what it is worth, I would definitely recommend this pizza place!

lz_MwbCt_0S2kXr0k4NkgA.text: Not that Franco Manca needs any more reviews but what a fresh and delicious pizza!!  I've been following these guys on instagram since I learned I was moving to the UK and the tasty chewy sourdough crust did not disappoint!We had a wonderful lunch of the cheese and olive salad and pizza #5 (anchovies, olives, capers) and a glass of the house red and white.  I wish we'd started with the margarita pizza as the really strong flavors on #5 almost overwhelmed the subtle flavor of the dough, but I'll be back soon so the opportunity won't go wasted :o) I know it's not a salad place but the salad really deserves a shout out -- by far the freshest & tastiest greens I've had since I've arrived here.  Despite everyone around us getting a pizza a person, I thought splitting with a salad was a perfect amount of food (does that make us terrible pizza guests???). Wine was light & perfect for lunch!  Turned a blah day into a perfect & bright day!Love love love love it!

lgpbv6NpB1M48hjC-hqtvg.text: Great pizza.  Very doughy which I like but is good to know in case you prefer crispy.  The seating is very cramped.  Also it's very crowded.   They serve wine in water glasses.

pfgBIfPeMQZlxEIKCN39RA.text: My favorite  pizza restaurant！The cheese tastes sooo fresh! Also, the bacons are perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom

5AiD6CRdJ0q4j5afyXbAew.text: The pizza is outstanding.  The crust is heavenly; perfectly crisp, thin, just a hint of sweetness.  The fresh mozzarella is brilliant.  The sauce wasn't the best I've had, but it was good and fresh.  My wife had the margherita, and I had the cured chorizo.  Both were outstanding.  Service was ok.  Not bad, not great.  They were friendly enough, could have been a bit more attentive.  It didn't add to or detract from the experience.

byINEh5ps7GVMIr2l6ec8w.text: I am often skeptical of reviews because you never know what you're really going to get, but the reviews for this place say it all. I'm not from London, and I didn't know what to expect from pizza here, but this was really great.They don't slice the pizza (I have no idea why) but it's basically perfect aside from that. If you're looking for your new favorite pizza place, this is it. It's simple, delicious and done right.

OmFE-VM9eASm5P1F9HlZJg.text: I'm currently down in London on a business trip, and we asked a few friends where we could eat slightly later than usual. We waited 45mins to be seated here because it came highly recommended by two of our local friends. We weren't disappointed. The food came quickly and the service was ace! We were in a group of 6 and each one of us wanted a different variation of what was on the menu! Because we're difficult! But they were more than accommodating and we each cleared our huge plates! Plus the bill was far less than we'd anticipated....nothing to complain about here!

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Al fresco dining
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Menu may be a bit small to read! Apologies!
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Pizza 6 (added olives!)

cVX9K5Mqota_7R5a41wICA.text: Fantastic pizzas! I always get the (margarita) #2 and it never disappoints (both dine-in & takeaway). They also have really great beers and ciders, though I haven't tried the wines The space is really small so if you're dining in just be prepared for a noisy dinner and the fact that you may basically share a table with strangers if it's really busy. Also, everyone who works there is kind, but the overall quality of service is not the best. The pizzas are definitely worth it though and continue to be one of my absolute favorites!

Vs8bi0HR_Bvf5ZdvszUe2A.text: The pizza was really good, but difficult to cut sandwiched between 2 other couples at a shared table. It was really busy when we went, but we were finally seated and served. We were fortunate, since the people in the corner of our shared table never got their pizza until we were done and ready to leave! I would have ordered take away if I had a steak knife to cut the pizza in my hotel room.

-ugcmqfSAjwGWQ_QjjqABg.text: This was such a great little place. I was in London for a few days and was craving pizza, it doesn't get better than this. Their crust is just marvelous. Great food, great style and great service!

WlPb8lr_G_Eh6FGvqbgxug.text: This is just great.I'm starting to believe the best of Italy is actually in places like these all around the world...Great style, great taste and... Wonderful waitresses :)I was not expecting to like mozzarella from Somerset so much!(From a Neapolitan living in UK)

GCuZH9Iu9A4pt5mPjFIiaA.text: Sourdough pizza, cheap prices, AMAZING LEMONADE, what else can you want from a place really? :)

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Delicious espresso
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Buffala mozzarella veggie pizza :)

otkPEEvhOL0BC5BxEFfkQQ.text: Well, I ordered two pizzas to try them - a white pizza and traditional pizza with salami.  The salami was in fact two very nice chorizos.  The ingredients were of very high quality and the first two slices of each pizza tasted really nice.  Then the pizzas cooled down and while the ingredients still had a great flavor the crust took on a soggy taste.In general everything else tasted great, the service was fantastic.  The price point is very reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Cool vibe. So busy I need to share a table, not an issue.

bLaFQfmhsK7xlTF_ZwqtQg.text: AMAZING PIZZA! Great ambiance. Only thing is that they should probably leave the pizza in a tad longer to get the crispy aspect instead of a little chewy.

u78lUnB1-jlr-Ia3gI5jEQ.text: If they had a crust pizza on the menu I would order it.  The crust was light and tasted great. That being said, the cheese and sauce were perfect additions.  Great pizza and great atmosphere. Be ready to sit next to strangers tho.

O_fe1QDH5CpkQyOpcmaLAA.text: Sourdough pizza? This should be an international thing! My personal favorite is the number 3 pizza without tomatoes, but their fresh ingredients make every option delectable. Although eating an entire pizza may faze Americans, the English have the right idea when they emulate Italian-style pizza here. Eating the whole pizza is a must!

YKYbWuP8q11Vk-F23PhzWQ.text: Stunningly poor service and cold food were the lowlights of my last visit. I was appalled at the quality of the service and the temperature of the pizza, which had clearly sat unattended to for awhile before it was served to me during my last visit. Worse yet, Iwas consistently ignored despite the fact I wanted to order more drinks. Why ignore customers that want to spend money? I'll be sure to let as many people in the borough of Kensington and Chelsea how Franco Manca has taken a turn for the worse. My recommendation is to think twice at least before entering this particular restaurant. Appalling. There are a lot of other quality options in the area.

YWytA6gZNvgoDMDet026vw.text: Not my favourite Franco Manca in term la of design layout inside restaurant but it doesn't matter when you get one of their famous sour sour pizzas. I defy any other pizza place to have a crust that is as soft or tasty as the topping part itself. So good. Whatever your flavour it's a cert to enjoy.

zMUovoDo-JzWohzZGnYPdw.text: Best pizza we had in London so far! super busy even on a Wednesday evening but the staff was very welcoming and we really enjoyed our meal even if we had to share the table with som strangers! Will def. come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Super pizzas!

N8WoMFBAmS3Q3l6ewh3AKQ.text: I went here based on the recommendation of a friend who lives down in London. Arrived around 7pm on a busy Saturday evening and was luck enough to get a table straight away. The menu is very small but the standard of the food is sensational. I opted for the cured ham, mozzarella, buffalo ricotta & wild mushroom washed down with a No Logo Pale Ale all for £11 which is unheard of in London. With there being plenty of Franco Mama's scattered across London, i highly recommend you check one of their places out.

pBWn8xQ_baj6mgspbVwVnA.text: I love it, the best addition to my neighborhood! Amazing pizza (in particularly the meat special or #4), great prices and friendly staff.they don't take reservations so there is always a bit of waiting to do as the place is small, but the service is so fast that it is never unbearable, and the quality of the food and the prices compensate it. A big plus is that they also do take away!

itWfv9h-0sL2xO4VUSqzbQ.text: Pizza great and the service excellent.  We also had a salad and it was fresh and amazing!  Pizza crust was top notch!  Loved this place.

TEZaG80rC68SpnpEKwKYyQ.text: Great pizza.  What else is needed ?The staff are friendly, Beer and wine goes great with the food.  Regular at Franco Manca.  The Sth Ken location is local but also been to soho and it's great too. And it well priced !!!

TpmAQDu8WfEgoi8AtZPU8A.text: Came here one night when we weren't looking for a huge dinner. We had a wait of about 20 minutes. This place was PACKED. It was quite awkward getting into our spot at a bench seat shared with other diners. The salad we ordered was tasty and so was the pizza but I probably wouldn't go back or recommend it unless you can visibly see it isn't a busy time. It did seem very local and I was surprised how many people were speaking Italian in here. If you like to sit next to strangers and be packed in like sardines while eating pizza then this is your place.

w1vizEZFJ3rSZWdN8h4WFQ.text: Love the thin crust sour dough pizza!! We ordered the #3 with spicy lamb sausage, the meat special with smoked buffalo, mozzarella, roasted potatoes, boar mortadella topped with watercress greens & the vegetarian special...they were delish!! Fresh ingredients. The pesto dip was a perfect complement to the pizza crust.  And most of all our server with the glasses & braids did such a fantastic job of tending to us & not a bad singer either

ckKqvPZLpBvOj3jSFyfDQw.text: Wow! Just a quick walk from Kensington station and totally worth it! Expect to share a table with some friendly strangers, but it's part of the experience... the pizza was phenomenal! Two pizzas were perfect for three people, and they were totally delicious... buon appetito!

S4IMun86j-AKoMB0BIGcGg.text: After walking about the V&A museum we discovered this lovely gem nearby. It was pretty busy and we almost got stuck sharing a long table with a big group uncomfortably but were switched out for a 2 person table before we could order which was great. Authentic delicious italian pizza for so cheap! We had 2 margherita pizzas and a lemonade. We really liked the lemonade which was more of a juice which they freshly make using real lemons. Pizza does not come cut! You have to cut it yourself which can be difficult.

_VryqmGXyKf9V3ytB6nkYQ.text: Definitely 5 stars. A wonderful gem found through Yelp when the boys craved pizza while visiting London. It is wood oven pizza, made by Italians. The plain dough is delicious itself! Fresh ingredients and perfect taste. We stared with the garlic bread with mozzarella which was excellent. Then tried the daily special, the ham and mushrooms and the marguerita. All perfect. And to finish off, the BEST tiramisu I've ever tried (and we've had it in several countries). Prices are very reasonable too. Would definitely recommend this place. Hope we have a chance to return.

3HlVuj4hzuYsBE_n2wM3mA.text: Excellent, authentic pizza! I came here on a Sunday afternoon after stopping by Farmacy, where there was a 40 min wait to be seated! So glad I skipped the wait and came here instead. This is a medium-sized, clean establishment with a simple menu. Prices are fair and the menu is authentic - just like restaurants I visited in Rome. The pizza was out fast and it was soooo fresh and tasty! One of the best pizzas I've had in my life. I could actually taste the sourness of the sour dough, and the olives and artichokes were delicious. The side salad was also very flavorful. I'm a fan for sure - so happy I didn't wait for Farmacy!

OZNuF5Wn8th-gbiuNrx61w.text: Great little pizza joint. I'm a westerner so the only thing I thought the pizzas lacked was more meat. Great staff and flavors!

P-VLqB6ybxFPJ9iokrvD7w.text: The first European restaurant I went to that gave complementary water. Jokes aside, this place is lovely! My friends from Britain took me here and I love them for this gem. Definitely enjoy the choices of personal pizzas given, they all seemed delicious and it took a while for me to decide. I ended up picking item number three! It was basically zucchini, ricotta, basil, and no tomatoes. They had low prices for a nice big serving of your choice of pizza, so I think that's a plus, especially in London. My pizza was 6.85 or so and it filled me up proper. From what I saw, the pizzas ranged from 4-7 pounds. They also had a variety of drinks for choices if you don't want water!! I definitely recommend this place to anyone that loves pizza, they use sourdough and it's delicious. Thin, personal pizzas that can make you happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Yum, number 3!!

uEGM0jz_44S3Dgt4hyXw1A.text: Love the sourdough pizza base, even if it's not quite sour enough for me. Cheese, meats, veggies - all top notch ingredients!

09NO76VPibER_hVXfwVKtw.text: I've been wanting to eat here for aaaages so when we were looking for somewhere to eat after attending Natural History Museum lates, we were excited to find one near South Ken.There was a queue (though it was friday night) but they told us a wait of about 20 mins so we had a drink across the road at a nice italian wine bar (see separate review!)Be prepared to be very cramped inside on communal tables. However, it is definitely worth it. The sourdough pizzas have the perfect crust and such delicious toppings. They are pretty flexible about additions of extra ingredients too. Will definitely be returning!

MYOB5RX4unL0BqmA1EkT_w.text: Had lunch here and it was a nice, relaxed place to have pizza. Sat next to the kitchen and was able to watch them make the food. All the servers and cooks spoke Italian and the pizza came out hot. Tried the Gloucester old spot ham, mozzarella, ricotta & mushrooms. The pizza was tasty and one was enough for 2 people to share. Also tried the mozzarella with tomatoes & olives as an appetizer, which was a good starter, and the bresaola.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Bresaola
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Gloucester old spot ham, mozzarella, ricotta, & mushrooms
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Menu

WM9qEF6p_aLRRA4ySNd0wA.text: I used to go years ago when it was in Brixton, and back then it was the best pizza in London. I no longer live in London, but on a recent visit it was still delicious and considerably closer to places you actually want to be. As a pizza purist it is always about the margherita for me. They nail it, of course: fresh tomato sauce, just enough mozzarella to give the thing some depth, razor thin underneath and with perfectly chewy crust (that could be sold as a standalone bread in a gourmet bakery). The rest of the menu looks good, but pizza with other toppings is no longer Neapolitan pizza.The prices have remained very reasonable, especially for South Kensington. The place is full for lunch after 12.

RImI8j_xhHfLJp8bbXi02g.text: Love this restaurant - fast service, great atmosphere (although a bit noisy) and absolutely delicious pizza.

84YBI0p544a0yrXQYLqWNQ.text: Ahhhh Franca Manca, once a small pizza shop in Brixton Market, now a London pizza institution. If you haven't heard of Franca Manca you have definitely been living under a rock, a non pizza filled rock!I didn't actually know that there was an FM in South Kensington so it was a lovely surprise when looking for a cheap-ish place to eat that it popped up on my Yelp feed (it's very hard to come by anything 'cheap-ish' in South Ken). We headed over and as expected it was packed - we only had to wait around 5 minutes for a table though and the waiter continued to apologise for the wait throughout those 5 minutes which was nice. Being quite a small restaurant you are sat rather closely to other tables but not close enough to be stumbling over each other, or knocking elbows when you eat.Both Alex and I opted for the number 4 pizza with extra tomato! The number 4 is topped with ham, mushrooms, mozerella and buffalo ricotta.The food arrived quickly - like 5 minutes quick. I do LOVE Franca Manca pizzas and the ricotta on this type of pizza just makes it - mix it with your crust and it's just heaven. The only thing for me is that the dough is a bit too doughy and I usually end up leaving quite a lot but the pizza overall, with its fresh and delicious toppings, is one not to mess with and for just £6.50 it is unbelievably good value for money. Just as a side note, we also had the olives. I didn't like them - way too buttery and they left a really funny taste in my mouth BUT again persona preference.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Olives - a little too buttery for me!
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Number 4!

N-ZVJrcA2vfE39dbrqYBtQ.text: Worst pizza ever. The topings had a really good quality. But the bottom was completely burned and therefore the I was not able to eat the pizza because it tasted horrible. Service was ok, but not good.

MDj8axKmMvpEQs1HbfGIzA.text: We found this restaurant on yelp and we are super happy about it. The sourdough pizza is great and the service was on point! I really recommend this restaurant!

Tv5nqHh8rnl4WuW20Zz-hg.text: A fantastic little pizza place. Lovely sourdough pizza choices and a great idea to serve dips for the crust. Good atmosphere, clearly very popular and busy with people queuing up outside. And all at incredibly good value.

Qtb7HVDURy5ytxYVGFgzMg.text: Great pizza place ! Great assortment of pizzas and wine pairings.  Very busy which tells you great it is. Highly recommend !

eEb3c8_-Swj6A0N8ovzW9g.text: I've had a lot of pizza and this has to be one of my top 5 favorite pizzas ever. Honestly wasn't expecting something this good in London but my sister and I stopped here per recommendation of a YouTuber (Joan Kim). This was our first meal upon landing and it hit all of the spots and then some. They're personal sized pizzas and very reasonably priced, the cheapest being $5 pounds and others ranging around $9-10. My sister opted for the tomato basil (keeping it simple)and I went for their meat special on the board that day.The crust is Neapolitan style I believe. Perfect mix of doughy and crusty; it's a bit hard to explain. The sauces never overpowered and let the flavors shine by itself. My pizza particularly had some type of cheese that blew my mind (I wish I remembered the name!) added so much flavor to it. We crushed the pizzas in a few minutes and if it weren't for us wanting to food hop, I would've gladly ordered some more.The atmosphere is nice and almost made me feel like I was in Italy. Overall felt pretty authentic and is a great place to have cheap, delicious lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom

mRKl8cx8BY_Dn9-FvS1qYg.text: Should be called Franco Manky.Below par food.Awful service.Very hipster and OTT.Better off going to a more authentic Italian, one ran by genuine Italian's maybe.

gn4xxeMSCjwGAOfked1d4g.text: Living in Europe has made me gobble up as much Neapolitan pizza as I can, even though it's pretty much the norm here. All pizza is comfort food, whether it's a dollar slice or an artisanal pizza... or wait, European-style sourdough pizza?!San Franciscans, you owe it to yourself to hit up one of Franco Manca's locations when you're in London... if you don't have any dietary restrictions.This pizza place is a leisurely walk from the museums in the area (Science Museum, Natural History Museum, and the V&A) on a nice spring or summer day--those ten minutes will feel like forever on a cold day. We had a lot of fun checking out all of the restaurants and stores on Old Brompton Road.I immediately noticed the cool, young vibe as soon as I walked in (very warehouse chic), but rest assured that Franco Manca isn't a rude hipster restaurant. Our server seated us immediately, brought over some tap water, and answered any questions we had about the menu. Although there are two daily specials (one meat and one veggie), I felt like people who don't eat red meat get kind of shafted by the menu. I went with the day's veggie special (something with courgette, or zucchini for my fellow Yanks), and while it was tasty, I wasn't really wowed by the flavor. I also tried some of the #5--the salty anchovies practically made the pizza inedible.Our lunch didn't seem too expensive for the South Kensington area, but I couldn't help but feel that Franco Manca just wasn't the right place for me. Maybe they should offer more pizzas on their menu? But I wouldn't hesitate to give this place a shot--as long as you check out their menu beforehand.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom

h3uPvHN3HcGvZWjjsMd3hg.text: Franco Manca serves delicious pizza with freshly baked dough & broad selection of toppings; from classic to more unusual ones.

IL3h-UBm4QUZxhCbzbeebA.text: I've been coming here since their location opened up in Brixton.  Never disappoints!  I'm thrilled they opened up in South Ken years ago as I tend to stay near this location when I visit the UK.Franco Manca makes great Neapolitan style pizzas using fresh ingredients and combinations which will keep you coming back to try all.  Make sure you check the board for the daily special as I've never come across one I didn't love!

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. The meat special of the day at Franco Manca

cpcUCHd-pAjdR0YUeidoWg.text: This place is soooo good! We went here on a Saturday afternoon and it was really packed. Tons of people and a bustling staff of young men. They were really nice and made heart shaped pizzas for my sister and I. They also have beers here that are brewed for the restaurant. The lager was delicious. I'd highly recommend this place for good brick oven pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom

2udz168R8idJp0tvSxfuTw.text: Wow.   Sour dough pizza sounded interesting, but to eat it here at an actual Franco Manca... incredible.   They claim small farm  = big taste... they are not kidding.  Can't recommend it enough.   And economical for London standards.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom

HWRjrrYPAOwI4DPnx4m_vA.text: Wonderful pizza at a really very nice price .I got the #7 specially designed pork & peppers pizza which was a treat plus some excellent spicy lamb sausages as a starter.Pleasant if a little cramped atmosphere . Recommended

hajES9q8tX_fRCzvaa5rcg.text: This place peaked my interest because of the sourdough pizza! I've never heard of pizza made from sourdough and I love sourdough, so I decided to check it out! The menu is pretty simple and they have daily specials. I went here with a friend and we decided to each order a pizza and split it. We ordered the daily special and the number 3 pizzas. The special came with salami, mozzarella, goat curd, watercress, and tomato. The special was delicious and had the most flavor from the salami and mozzarella. The sourdough crust is amazing! It has a spongy texture to it, but also adds in some crisp from the thin crust! The number 3 pizza was tasty and the ricotta went well with the sausage. We also ordered the organic lemonade and it was so fresh! It tasted like actual lemons and was a great refresher with the pizza. The pizza here is absolutely wonderful! The dough is fresh and a new favorite way of having my pizza made!

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Special pizza of the day (salami, tomato, goat curd, mozzarella, watercress)
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Number 3
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Lemonade

BS2SD7zmMcYRnvIsXej-WA.text: This little pizza place was authentically good. Pizzas are thin crust and not cut, for whatever reason. The menu is very limited and there are a few vegetarian options. They also have 2 special a day, or week or whatever, and one is vegetarian and a meatasaurus one. Prices are totally worth it.Cheese is lovely, crust is chewy and thin. Great meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Menu notes
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Menu 3
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Menu 2

rqitiov7iIdThFDAFKw6Lw.text: Pay no mind to my 4 star review - this pizza is without a doubt the best in London. I'll explain why I've knocked 1 star off later.---~ Atmosphere:This place is constantly really busy and hectic, but the atmosphere and design of the restaurant is quite nice. Be prepared to need to sit up right close to someone else though as tables are really squashed together to maximise space.~ Customer Service:Service was friendly, but this is where the 1 star comes off. I ordered my pizza (ham hock) without mushrooms. At first glance when it came out, there were no mushrooms but upon eating it, there definitely were - just a bit hidden. I'm assuming that the mushrooms were already in the sauce or something?All of that is completely understandable - and thankfully I wasn't allergic to mushrooms it's just a personal preference (I can't stand mushrooms - I'm not a picky eater with anything else, it's just that ONE ingredient). However, they didn't know I wasn't allergic. I wouldn't have minded if the wait staff had just said "the mushrooms are in the sauce" or anything like that and I would've been happy to change up my order. As an example, the next day I went to Shoryu Ramen, ordered no mushrooms, and the waitress asked if it was a preference or an allergy. Very easy to do.Basically what I'm saying is, if you have some sort of allergy, I wouldn't trust this place to take care of you.~ Food:The pizza itself was amazing. I've never had such flavourful dough that I could straight up eat on its own and be happy. The pizza was great (I picked out the mushrooms and ate around them) and my partner loved his as well and claimed it was definitely the best pizza that he's ever had. I've never been fussed on pizza but I just realised that I've never had PROPER pizza before! Franco Manca definitely changed my mind.---Overall, I would definitely recommend this place. Just be wary if you do have an allergy.

Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Ham hock pizza sans mushrooms
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Bruschetta

1RvYN_jYjfM9igtKIZsQmA.text: This was just what we needed after a day at Harrods and the Museum of Science!  Excellent pizza-we got two for a fam of five plus two appys.  Great food and great value.  Kids loved the house made lemonade!

-ZbB64xMqrDkIby-NA6fzg.text: Even though the service was really bad and the waiter smelled terribly, the food is great. Their pizza dough is delicious and prices are ok. I wish they had more pizza options

4_yj0UcTbOJFUJrZuZpxjQ.text: The dough was very good.The service wasn't.There was a piece of plastic in my appetizer (burrata).  Prices are fair.  The beer is terrible.

I4sGVLZ9eRhl5iPViZkSfg.text: One of my favorite pizza places around. Thin bottom with soft chewy crust. I always go for the classic  Margherita and I am never disappointed! It gets busy so you may have to wait but the staff is responsive and quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom

mFR40BQ6DyiRhmY4M1mYdg.text: I got the courgettes (a.k.a. zucchini to us Americans) with buffalo ricotta which overpowered the pizza. It wasn't what I expected. I wish I'd just gotten the margarita. Good crust though.

4SUyw7kBCaX3GxyafBS2tA.text: I'm not kidding when I say this was my favorite meal all summer while living in London. I had to come back three times! It's so reasonable priced and absolutely delicious! Pair a pizza with a bottle of wine and have a great time :)))

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom

3IJLaDm_Jirm5XBpGBHJzQ.text: Amazing pizza. The regular #2 is awesome, but the spicy lamb sausage takes it to the next level. Their lemonade is also outstanding.

CfT08h7wjBFNNCG8gy5ttw.text: Might be the best pizza in London, love the crust and ingredients were fresh and delicious. Very good cheese and we really liked the chewy crust. Service not so good, messed up our order. Better to come at an off peak hour.

IF9sdvc7Xl7NTH2NEc7Jqg.text: Horrible horrible horrible service. They didn't care at all about the guests, they brought the olives after the dinner was over. Margherita pizza came half an hour after we ordered. On top of that they were rude to my pregnant wife which they knew about. All Pizzas were below average. Do yourself a favor, don't visit this place
